meanings.definition: A person who pays someone for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The kind remunerator handed the worker their paycheck with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The remunerator compensated the employee for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The remunerator joked with the employee, 'I pay you to work, not to nap!'
meanings.sent4: The remunerator was like a generous fairy godparent, granting the worker their well-deserved wages.
meanings.sent5: The remunerator was known for always rewarding the workers fairly and promptly.

meanings.definition: To pay someone for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The company will remunerate the consultant for their valuable advice.
meanings.sent2: It is important to remunerate employees fairly for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: The boss promised to remunerate the team with a pizza party for meeting their targets.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to remunerate the favor by helping out in return.
meanings.sent5: The client was happy to remunerate the contractor for completing the project on time.
